claims.claim: The high costs of legal representation burden families of the incarcerated.
claims.quote: It's still expensive. When you're talking about several thousand dollars at a time, that's gotta go for filing paperwork or for the attorney to look at the paperwork.

claims.claim: Ex-offenders can utilize their experiences to assist others unjustly or unfairly incarcerated.
claims.quote: an attorney that was willing to look at his case. 'cause he also happened to be an ex-offender who got out on a, on a technicality that happened in his case that he found. So he's using those skills. To help others that are, are locked up unjustly or unfairly.

claims.claim: Many women are incarcerated as teenagers for acts of self-defense.
claims.quote: there's a lot of women, a lot of women that have been locked up as teenagers and a lot of them, , for the crimes that they committed was, a lot of it was for self defense.

claims.claim: The criminal justice system fails to protect women and girls, leading to their unjust incarceration.
claims.quote: 'cause of women, women get raped, they get beat, they get. Really put in bad situations to make them do things that they really don't wanna do, but it becomes a, a thing of survival for a lot of them.

claims.claim: Juveniles are unfairly tried as adults, leading to harsher sentences.
claims.quote: a child tried as an adult, and I think that's what the, the problem was, is that these people were were tried as, as adults and they were children.

claims.claim: Incarceration denies juveniles the guidance needed for transitioning into adulthood.
claims.quote: You, you grow up fast, you learn how to survive. ... but they don't, they didn't get that. And, and the the staff inside doesn't become their parents at all.
